newsitem.title: USA: Chances for US bond simplification growing - NAST.
newsitem.headline: Chances for US bond simplification growing - NAST.

text.p: A National Association of State Treasurers official said Saturday that chances are improving that bond "simplification" measures will land in a major tax bill being drafted by U.S. House Ways and Means Committee Chairman Bill Archer, R-Texas.
Christopher Allen, director of federal relations for the treasurers group, made the statement during a workshop at the Government Finance Officers Association's annual meeting here.
"I've had conversations with individuals working on ... elements of the President' proposal," Allen said.
"They indicated that staff of the Ways and Means Committee look favorably toward including the President's simplification package in the chairman's mark," Allen said,

The Clinton Administration in mid-April asked Congress to adopt a variety of provisions to simplify the nation's tax code, including five proposals to ease the Internal Revenue Service's arbitrage rebate rules.

The White House plan would, for example, exempt from arbitrage rebate those governmental bond issues that have a weighted average maturity of at least 10 years and that meet certain minimum spending requirements.
